body:
Comment 1: 
The program fails to compile: adeline.go:175: func main must have no arguments and no
return values.

It's unreasonable to expect people to read and debug a 956 line program. Reduce the
problem to a short program of a dozen lines or less.

Read the documentation carefully before you do your homework.

"The receiver type must be of the form T or *T where T is a type name."
Method declarations, The Go Programming Language Specification.
http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Method_declarations

"The rule about pointers vs. values for receivers is that value methods can be invoked
on pointers and values, but pointer methods can only be invoked on pointers. This is
because pointer methods can modify the receiver; invoking them on a copy of the value
would cause those modifications to be discarded."
Pointers vs. Values, Methods, Effective Go.
http://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html#pointers_vs_values
